content:
Since I was shamelessly self-promoting on Twitter, I can't lower myself further by repeating it here:

https://twitter.com/HigherGeometer/status/1327792723693170688

As a student I proved a version of Quillen's Theorem A for categories internal to Top. The statement was lurking on my private nLab pages, though not the proof. Anyone interested to see it?

- theHigherGeometer (@HigherGeometer)

https://twitter.com/HigherGeometer/status/1327825343000940544

Part of the point was to get a homotopy equivalence, not just a weak equivalence. https://ncatlab.org/davidroberts/show/Theorem+A+for+topological+categories The proof only uses technology available to Quillen at the time of the original Theorem A. I should polish and release the pdf, last edited in 2008, in case it's useful.

- theHigherGeometer (@HigherGeometer)
I'm sure this could be proved with some very high-powered stuff, but I have a soft spot for basic/elementary proofs of things that shouldn't be hard.
Gah, might be wrong stream. Should be in alg top, maybe?
This topic was moved here from #theory: category theory > Theorem A for topological categories by Matteo Capucci
